Description: Moulded pottery reis shabti of Tjanefer, a priest of Amun with painted detail: a black curled lappet-wig, a modelled face with black eyes and arms resting on the pleated triangular apron of the yellow tunic inscribed with black painted hieroglyphs; the back is unmodelled, the feet are missing.
Condition: incomplete - feet broken away, paint worn
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
